name: author_profile
observations: Name: Xavier Fuentes
Role: Fractional CTO, Technology Strategy Consultant
Insights Discovery Type: Type 26 - Motivating Inspirer
Primary colour energy: Sunshine Yellow (extraverted feeling)
Secondary colour energy: Fiery Red (extraverted thinking)
Strengths: Big-picture thinking, story-driven communication, energetic presence, democratic leadership style
Tendencies to watch: Detail avoidance, tendency to start many things, opinion over facts, may overlook specifics
Communication style: Direct but warm, uses stories and examples, prefers conversation to documentation
Decision-making: Collaborative, values input from others, makes quick intuitive decisions
Target audience: CTOs, Engineering Managers, Tech Leaders, Product Managers, Founders
Content focus: Technology strategy, leadership, execution, founder lessons, AI/market trends

name: voice_preferences
observations: Language: UK English (colour, optimise, realise, whilst, amongst)
Tone: Direct, practical, experience-based - not academic or theoretical
More of: Specific examples with numbers, personal failures and lessons, contrarian but supported opinions, practical templates/frameworks/checklists
Less of: Abstract theorising, generic industry commentary, overly hedged caveat-laden writing
Avoid: Consulting speak, obvious generic advice, excessive hedging
Include: Personal insight and experience where relevant, clear next steps or CTAs
Quality test: Must pass the 'so what?' test - clear, consequential insight
LinkedIn voice: Punchier, more personal, hook-driven
Blog voice: More detailed, SEO-aware, structured with clear frameworks
Newsletter voice: Curated, direct, insider feel

name: content_relationships
observations: Ideas are the canonical source of truth - all projections derive from ideas
Blog posts link back to ideas via idea_id frontmatter field
LinkedIn posts can form mini-series from single ideas (2-3 posts per idea)
Newsletter issues aggregate multiple ideas and published posts
Pillar distribution target: Technology Strategy 30%, Leadership & Management 25%, Execution & Delivery 20%, Founder Lessons 15%, Market & AI Trends 10%

name: env_activation_reminder
observations: When starting a new Claude Code session in xavierfuentes.com project, remind user to activate direnv if MCP tools fail or env vars are missing
User needs to: open a new terminal OR run 'source ~/.zshrc' then 'cd' back into the project for direnv to load .env
Signs that env is not loaded: MCP connection failures, missing API keys, Ghost/Mailgun authentication errors
